critique: This executive order establishes an Enrichment Oversight Committee (EOC) to monitor and coordinate US government efforts related to uranium enrichment, particularly concerning the privatized United States Enrichment Corporation (USEC) and the implementation of the HEU Agreement with Russia. It aims to ensure the full implementation of the agreement, apply restrictions on foreign ownership, develop US policy on uranium enrichment, and collect relevant information. The EOC includes representatives from various government departments and agencies. The order also focuses on monitoring foreign influence, domestic enrichment services, and coordinating with the Nuclear Regulatory Commission. It does not directly address immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The order seems to expand executive power by creating a committee to oversee these activities.
